result.markdown:
---
title: "Colors & Palettes"
subtitle: "Complete guide to the CPAL color system"
---




## Overview

The cpaltemplates color system provides 21 functions for working with CPAL's carefully designed color palettes. All colors are sourced from `_brand.yml` and designed for WCAG accessibility compliance.

---

## Primary Brand Colors

CPAL's 5 core brand colors form the foundation of all palettes:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cpal_colors_primary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 midnight      teal      pink    orange      gold 
"#004855" "#007A8C" "#C3257B" "#ED683F" "#AB8C01" 
```


:::
:::


| Color | Hex | Use Case |
|-------|-----|----------|
| **Midnight** | `#004855` | Dark backgrounds, headers, emphasis |
| **Teal** | `#007A8C` | Primary brand color, links, highlights |
| **Pink** | `#C3257B` | Accent, call-to-action, contrast |
| **Orange** | `#ED683F` | Warnings, alerts, secondary accent |
| **Gold** | `#AB8C01` | Tertiary accent, highlights |

---

## Core Color Functions

### `cpal_colors()`

The main entry point for accessing any CPAL color or palette.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Get all primary colors
cpal_colors()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 midnight      teal      pink    orange      gold 
"#004855" "#007A8C" "#C3257B" "#ED683F" "#AB8C01" 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Get a single color by name
cpal_colors("teal")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
     teal 
"#007A8C" 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Get multiple specific colors
cpal_colors(c("teal", "pink", "gold"))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
     teal      pink      gold 
"#007A8C" "#C3257B" "#AB8C01" 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Get a palette
cpal_colors("teal_seq_5")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#C0E7EE" "#95CFDA" "#47ACBD" "#007A8C" "#004855"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Limit number of colors
cpal_colors("main", n = 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#004855" "#007A8C" "#C3257B"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Reverse palette order
cpal_colors("teal_seq_5", reverse = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#004855" "#007A8C" "#47ACBD" "#95CFDA" "#C0E7EE"
```


:::
:::


---

### `cpal_colors_extended()`

Returns all 17+ colors including primary colors and shades:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cpal_colors_extended()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
     midnight          teal          pink        orange          gold 
    "#004855"     "#007A8C"     "#C3257B"     "#ED683F"     "#AB8C01" 
         gray     gray_blue teal_lightest  teal_lighter    teal_light 
    "#919191"     "#798AA1"     "#D8EFF4"     "#C0E7EE"     "#95CFDA" 
     teal_mid     teal_dark    pink_light       neutral        yellow 
    "#47ACBD"     "#025968"     "#B888AC"     "#EBEBEB"     "#E5CB50" 
   green_teal     teal_blue 
    "#76A772"     "#6B9BDE" 
```


:::
:::


---

## Viewing Palettes

### All Available Palettes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list_cpal_palettes()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "primary"           "main"              "main_3"           
 [4] "main_4"            "main_gray"         "blues"            
 [7] "compare"           "teal_seq_4"        "teal_seq_5"       
[10] "teal_seq_6"        "yellow_teal_seq_4" "yellow_teal_seq_5"
[13] "yellow_teal_seq_6" "pink_teal_3"       "pink_teal_5"      
[16] "pink_teal_6"      
```


:::
:::


### Visual Palette Display


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
view_cpal_palettes()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![All CPAL color palettes](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/view-all-palettes-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


---

## Palette Types

### Categorical Palettes

For discrete data with distinct categories:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
view_cpal_palettes(c("main", "main_3", "main_4", "main_gray"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Categorical palettes for discrete data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/categorical-palettes-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


**Usage example:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_bar() +
  scale_fill_cpal("main_3") +
  labs(title = "Count by Cylinder", x = "Cylinders", y = "Count") +
  theme_cpal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Using categorical palette](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/categorical-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


---

### Sequential Palettes

For continuous or ordered data:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
view_cpal_palettes(c("teal_seq_4", "teal_seq_5", "teal_seq_6", "yellow_teal_seq_5"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Sequential palettes for continuous data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/sequential-palettes-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


**Usage example:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = hp)) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  scale_color_cpal_c("teal_seq_5") +
  labs(
    title = "Fuel Efficiency by Weight",
    subtitle = "Color shows horsepower",
    x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
    y = "Miles per Gallon",
    color = "Horsepower"
  ) +
  theme_cpal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Using sequential palette for continuous data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/sequential-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


---

### Diverging Palettes

For data with a meaningful midpoint:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
view_cpal_palettes(c("pink_teal_3", "pink_teal_5", "pink_teal_6"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Diverging palettes for data with midpoints](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/diverging-palettes-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


**Usage example:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Create sample data with positive and negative changes
change_data <- data.frame(
  category = LETTERS[1:7],
  change = c(-15, -8, -2, 0, 5, 12, 20)
)

ggplot(change_data, aes(x = category, y = change, fill = change)) +
  geom_col() +
  scale_fill_gradient2(
    low = "#C3257B",
    mid = "#EBEBEB",
    high = "#007A8C",
    midpoint = 0
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Year-over-Year Change",
    x = "Category",
    y = "Change (%)"
  ) +
  theme_cpal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Using diverging palette for change data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/diverging-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


---

## ggplot2 Scale Functions

### Discrete Scales


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  scale_color_cpal("main_3") +
  labs(
    title = "Discrete Color Scale",
    color = "Cylinders"
  ) +
  theme_cpal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Using scale_color_cpal() for discrete data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/discrete-scale-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


### Continuous Scales


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_cpal_c("teal_seq_5") +
  labs(title = "Continuous Fill Scale") +
  theme_cpal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Using scale_fill_cpal_c() for continuous data](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/continuous-scale-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::


---

## Color Interpolation

### `cpal_color_ramp()`

Generate smooth gradient between two colors:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Gradient from teal to pink
cpal_color_ramp("teal", "pink", n = 7)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#007A8C" "#206B89" "#415D86" "#614F83" "#824180" "#A2337D" "#C3257B"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Using color names from brand.yml
cpal_color_ramp("teal_lightest", "midnight", n = 5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#D8EFF4" "#A2C5CC" "#6C9BA4" "#36717C" "#004855"
```


:::
:::


### `cpal_color_gradient()`

Create gradient through multiple colors:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Three-color gradient
cpal_color_gradient(c("pink", "neutral", "teal"), n = 9)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "#C3257B" "#CC5697" "#D688B3" "#E1B9CF" "#EBEBEB" "#B0CED3" "#75B2BB"
[8] "#3A96A3" "#007A8C"
```


:::
:::

---
## Color Validation (Accessibility)

### `validate_color_contrast()`

Check if two colors meet WCAG contrast requirements:

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Check teal on white (should pass AA)
validate_color_contrast("#007A8C", "#FFFFFF")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
$foreground
[1] "#007A8C"

$background
[1] "#FFFFFF"

$contrast_ratio
[1] 5.05

$level
[1] "AA"

$large_text
[1] FALSE

$threshold
[1] 4.5

$passes
[1] TRUE

$recommendation
[1] "Passes WCAG AA (ratio: 5.05:1, required: 4.5:1)"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Check with AAA standard (stricter)
validate_color_contrast("#007A8C", "#FFFFFF", level = "AAA")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
$foreground
[1] "#007A8C"

$background
[1] "#FFFFFF"

$contrast_ratio
[1] 5.05

$level
[1] "AAA"

$large_text
[1] FALSE

$threshold
[1] 7

$passes
[1] FALSE

$recommendation
[1] "FAILS WCAG AAA (ratio: 5.05:1, required: 7.0:1). Consider using darker foreground or lighter background."
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Midnight on white (high contrast)
validate_color_contrast("#004855", "#FFFFFF", level = "AAA")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
$foreground
[1] "#004855"

$background
[1] "#FFFFFF"

$contrast_ratio
[1] 10.2

$level
[1] "AAA"

$large_text
[1] FALSE

$threshold
[1] 7

$passes
[1] TRUE

$recommendation
[1] "Passes WCAG AAA (ratio: 10.20:1, required: 7.0:1)"
```


:::
:::

### `validate_brand_colors()`

Check all CPAL palette colors for accessibility:

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
validate_brand_colors()
```
:::

---


## Choosing the Right Palette

### Quick Reference

| Data Type | Recommended Palettes |
|-----------|---------------------|
| **Categories (â‰¤3)** | `main_3`, `compare` |
| **Categories (4-5)** | `main`, `main_4` |
| **Categories (6+)** | `main_gray` |
| **Sequential/Continuous** | `teal_seq_5`, `yellow_teal_seq_5` |
| **Diverging (with midpoint)** | `pink_teal_5`, `pink_teal_3` |
| **Binary comparison** | `compare`, `blues` |

---

## Complete Example


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Prepare data
car_data <- mtcars |>
  mutate(
    cylinders = factor(cyl),
    efficiency = ifelse(mpg > median(mpg), "High", "Low")
  )

# Create visualization
ggplot(car_data, aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = cylinders, size = wt)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_color_cpal("main_3") +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(2, 8)) +
  labs(
    title = "Vehicle Performance Analysis",
    subtitle = "Fuel efficiency by horsepower, colored by cylinder count",
    x = "Horsepower",
    y = "Miles per Gallon",
    color = "Cylinders",
    size = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
    caption = "Source: Motor Trend Car Road Tests (1974)"
  ) +
  theme_cpal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Complete visualization with CPAL colors and theme](colors-palettes_files/figure-html/complete-example-1.png){width=100%}
:::
:::
